newsitem.title: USA: North Sea Brent crude trades steady late in U.S.
newsitem.headline: North Sea Brent crude trades steady late in U.S.

text.p: North Sea Brent paper crude cargoes traded at steady prices Thursday in the U.S. aftermarket window, according to traders.
July Brent changed hands at $18.62 for a partial deal of 300 lots, a two cent drop from the IPE settlement at $18.64 a barrel.
Other trades had July Brent move for 500 lots in two separate deals at $18.65, and a fourth transaction at $18.68 for a small 168 lot deal, traders said.
A pair of inter-month spreads moved as well, with two separate deals confirmed for June/July Brent at minus three cents, around steady from late talk in London.
